info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 1:20AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH FREQUENT LIGHTNING AND HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT FRANKLIN...STEPHENS...HABERSHAM...RABUN AND OCONEE COUNTIES UNTIL 215 AM EDT... At 117 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a cluster of thunderstorms with frequent lightning and heavy rainfall along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Clayton to 5 miles northwest of Toccoa to 10 miles northwest of Homer, and moving east at 30 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Toccoa, Seneca, Walhalla, Clayton, Clarkesville, Carnesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Westminster and Lavonia. Very heavy rainfall rates up to one inch per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and saturated soil conditions could cause a few trees to fall and isolated power outages may result. The heavy rainfall may produce isolated flooding in areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storms approach.
